page.title: 11PLUMP HILL, MITCHELDEAN
page.content: Until 1984, the scattered hillside settlement at Plump Hill, about one mile south of Mitcheldean had its own small Primary School. In July of that year the school closed due to the number of pupils having fallen to a very low level. The buildings were however in good condition, and after much discussion it was agreed to allow the Wilderness Field Study Centre to take them over as an additional department for day visits for a trial period. The school is situated at the end of a narrow lane, on the edge of open country, with a wealth of environments in the nearby woods and hillsides. So successful has the centre proved with its heavy bookings by school parties, that it has been agreed to continue its use in 1985/86, and hopefully beyond.
